page.title: 05MORETON SCHOOL BADGE&UNIFORM
page.content: The school badge is shaped like a shield. It is in 3 sections. In one of the sections there is a cross.This is because we are a Church of England School. In another section there are three scimitars that stand for the county of Essex.In the third section there are the initials of the school M.P.S. We do have a uniform, but more children wear it in winter than in summer. The school colours are blue/grey and maroon. The uniform for the boys is a pair of grey or black trousers, white shirt and school tie,and for the girls is a grey skirt and a white blouse and tie. In the summer the girls can wear a pink or blue gingham dress. Over half the children usually wear uniform, and others sometimes do.
